meanings.definition: Establish (an attitude, habit, or belief) so firmly that change is very difficult or unlikely.
meanings.sent1: She was entrenching her fear of spiders by avoiding them at all costs.
meanings.sent2: The political party's propaganda was entrenching their supporters' loyalty.
meanings.sent3: John's love for pizza was so entrenching that he dreamt of becoming a pizza slice.
meanings.sent4: The idea of equality was entrenching itself in the minds of the young generation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's inspiring words were entrenching a sense of determination in her students.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers were entrenching the battlefield for protection.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers were entrenching the area to lay down pipes.
meanings.sent3: The gardeners were entrenching the soil to plant new flowers.
meanings.sent4: The ants were entrenching their nest deep underground.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologists were entrenching the site to uncover ancient artifacts.
